author: Dr Ben Miles
description:
Scientists at Northwestern University have developed a wireless, ultra-thin brain implant that uses red light to stimulate neurons, without needing surgery. This device enables the brain to process new sensory inputs, offering potential breakthroughs in therapeutic neurotechnologies.

Source Article: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41593-025-02127-6
